item.title: Choosing Metrics
item.description: ‘Tis the college and job application season of the year. If only schools and companies have crystal balls to see into each candidate’s future achievements, they need not interview people; since they do not have such a thing, SAT scores, GPA, internships, and other quantifiable metrics are used to aid decisions. Simplifications are by no means ideal â€” As Goodhart put it (often paraphrased), “When a measure becomes a metric, it ceases to be a good measure.
